Package io.github.upendramanike.testkit

Class AsyncTestUtils

java.lang.Object
io.github.upendramanike.testkit.AsyncTestUtils
public class AsyncTestUtils extends Object
Utilities for deterministic async testing in Spring Boot applications. Helps avoid flaky tests caused by timing issues.

Example usage: 


 CompletableFuture<String> future = asyncOperation();
 String result = AsyncTestUtils.await(future, Duration.ofSeconds(5));
 assertEquals("expected", result);

    • await

      public static <T> T await(CompletableFuture<T> future, Duration timeout)
      Awaits completion of a CompletableFuture with a timeout.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      future - the future to await
      timeout - the maximum time to wait
      Returns:
      the result of the future
      Throws:
      AssertionError - if the future doesn't complete within the timeout

    • await

      public static <T> T await(Supplier<CompletableFuture<T>> supplier, Duration timeout)
      Executes a supplier and waits for its result with a timeout. Useful for testing async operations that return CompletableFuture.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the result type
      Parameters:
      supplier - the supplier to execute
      timeout - the maximum time to wait
      Returns:
      the result
      Throws:
      AssertionError - if the operation doesn't complete within the timeout

    • waitFor

      public static void waitFor(Supplier<Boolean> condition, Duration timeout, Duration pollInterval)
      Waits for a condition to become true, polling at regular intervals.
      Parameters:
      condition - the condition to check
      timeout - the maximum time to wait
      pollInterval - the interval between checks
      Throws:
      AssertionError - if the condition doesn't become true within the timeout
